Job Title: Project Engineer

Location: McIntosh, AL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Who We Are

Hargrove supplies unparalleled services in engineering, procurement, construction management, and technical services in the industrial, commercial, and government sectors. With over 2,000 Teammates across the US, we build long-term support relationships in the energy generation, manufacturing, research and development, and process-heavy industry in on-site support arrangements, in plant-level small projects and consulting roles, and in larger capital projects.

Hargrove’s key operating principle is to provide the Right People, in the Right Place, at the Right Time. We believe that relationships and partnering together provide the best results and long-term benefits for our clients.

Work-life balance and flexibility is a key focus area for Hargrove. We’re happy to discuss flexible working hours, patterns, and locations to suit you and the business.

What You'll Be Doing

Job Scope: This role will assure the completion of capital projects within cost, schedule, and performance goals. The engineer will manage capital projects for new or expanded manufacturing facilities typically up to $5 million. This professional is expected to also be capable of providing engineering support of ongoing and new operations and of mentoring less-experienced staff.

Primary Responsibilities Will Include But Not Be Limited To

Prepare a detailed scope of project in conjunction with process engineering, process technology, and manufacturing. Work with the project team through project completion.Prepare and route Capital Approval Requests (CARs).Set up cost control and reporting for projectsControl the flow of information between Olin and representatives of engineering firms, equipment vendors, and contractors in the formulation, design and execution of projects.Work with technical resources to prepare detailed specifications for materials and equipment to enable purchasing to obtain competitive bids. Responsible for evaluating bids and making recommendations to purchasing.Coordinate the field construction efforts through interpretation of plans, specifications and schedules and work with construction personnel to ensure a safe, timely, cost effective, and quality project.Submit project reports detailing the status of the project with respect to engineering, procurement, cost construction, and schedule.Provide overall coordination of the various disciplines on the project to assure a coordinated and efficient use of design, engineering, and construction manpower. Promote satisfactory human relations, personnel morale, and job effectivenessAssure the technical correctness of the project by coordinating the review of all drawings, specifications and equipment inquiries.Control various stages of engineering and constructions costs to ensure that each project is completed within the budget appropriation.Design and execute project to ensure compliance with OSHA’s Process Safety Management Elements

Ideal Background

Education: Bachelor or Master of Science degree in Engineering from an accredited university is required.

Registration: Professional Engineering and/or Project Management Professional (PMP) registration is highly preferred.

Experience: This position requires 5+ years of relevant experience in engineering and project management.

Demonstrated construction management and leadership abilities. Communicates effectively internal and external contacts. Experience in leading multi-functional teams preferred.Knowledge of applicable industrial standards; i.e. ASME, API, ANSI, ASTM.Thorough understanding of manufacturing equipment; i.e. tanks, pumps, piping, HVAC, industrial refrigeration, etc.Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office products including Word, Excel and Project. Knowledge of SAP and AutoCAD preferred. Experience in the use of computerized project management systems preferred.Occasional travel requiredMust be able to obtain a Transportation Worker Identification Card (TWIC).

Physical Requirements

Ability to sit, stand, or walk for long periods of time.

Hargrove Culture

We work to create an environment founded on trust, personal integrity, and a “team mentality” so that each person understands the value of their contributions both on a project and company-wide level. We know that each person on our team contributes to the success of our company by pairing expertise and passion to meet and exceed the needs of the clients we serve across the globe.

Our safety culture protects and promotes the well-being of every person who works with us and every person touched by our work.

As a 100% Teammate owned company, we proudly offer a comprehensive benefits package including, paid holidays, personal paid time off, medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance, 401(k), and other benefits to eligible Teammates.

Equal Opportunity Employment Statement

Hargrove is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, color, national origin, religion, age, sex (including gender, sexual orientation, pregnancy, sexual identity, marital or family status), disability, military service or obligations, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Hargrove is a drug-free workplace.

The selected candidate must be authorized to work in the United States.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
